definitions.definition: one of a set of small boxes, open at the front, in which letters and messages are left for different people:
examples: Leave the report in my pigeonhole when you've read it.

definitions.definition: to have an often unfair idea of what type someone or something is:
examples: He is a film producer who can't be conveniently pigeonholed.

definitions.definition: to put something away or leave it until a later time:
examples: Consultants found the experience frustrating - their reports were only partly implemented, or, worse still, just pigeonholed.
